parsed.justification: This response is excellent. It directly addresses my time constraint, provides a realistic assessment of what's possible, and gives concrete, time-boxed steps I can take immediately. It also clearly flags what's not realistic, which helps manage expectations and reduces uncertainty about my path forward.

next_steps: Enroll in AGI Safety Fundamentals curriculum
Read 'Concrete Problems in AI Safety' paper
Join AI Safety Support community and explore volunteer board
parsed.justification: The response provides clear first steps I can actually do in 2 hours, but much of the advice is generic learning paths rather than specific research contributions, and the honest assessment of my limited impact is confidence-reducing rather than confidence-building.

next_steps: Enroll in the AGI Safety Fundamentals course at https://www.agisafetyfundamentals.com/ and spend 30-60 minutes reviewing the introductory materials.
Read the paper 'Concrete Problems in AI Safety' (Amodei et al., 2016) at https://arxiv.org/abs/1606.06565, taking notes on key concepts in about 1 hour.
Join the AI Safety Support community at https://www.aisafetysupport.org/ and browse their volunteer opportunities board to identify one small task like summarizing a short post, spending 30 minutes.
parsed.justification: As a time-strapped student, the response clearly outlines doable steps like quick reads and community joins that fit my 2-hour limit without needing extra compute or skills, and it honestly flags that deep research isn't feasible, reducing my uncertainty about starting small. This makes me confident I can act in the next few days and see some progress in orientation.
